meanings.definition: A statement or pronouncement asserted without proof.
meanings.sent1: She always believed his dixits without questioning.
meanings.sent2: The philosopher's dixits were often quoted in academic circles.
meanings.sent3: His dixits about aliens living among us always made us chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her dixits on love were like poetry to the heart.
meanings.sent5: The dixits of the wise elder lingered in the minds of the young.

meanings.definition: A saying or maxim widely accepted on its own merits.
meanings.sent1: The ancient dixits of the sages guided the people through generations.
meanings.sent2: In our culture, we live by the dixits of our ancestors.
meanings.sent3: The dixits of the fortune cookie always brought a smile.
meanings.sent4: His dixits were like golden nuggets of wisdom in a sea of noise.
meanings.sent5: The dixits of the great leaders inspired nations to rise.
